bioghist.p: The James family, originally from Wales, came to the United States in 1711. Isaiah James (b. 1830s?) moved to Germantown, Pennsylvania and purchased property there. Isaiah's son Charles Henry James (1870-1957) worked at First National Bank, before joining his father's grocery firm, Thomas C. Fluke & Company. Charles Henry married Nellie J. Hussey; they had no children. Charles Henry James's nephew was Charles Mason James (b. 1910). Charles Mason married Mary Effie Cameron. Both of them were historians and Charles Mason was a prize-winning amateur filmmaker. Their daughter was Margaret Mason James (b. 1944), an educator who taught English as a second language.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of the papers of several generations of the James family. The papers include: the correspondence of Isaiah, Charles Henry, Charles Mason, and Margaret Mason James; scrapbooks, journals and travel diaries kept by Charles M. James; travel diaries of Margaret M. James; photographs (late-19th century to mid 20th century); 16mm and 8mm films taken by Charles M. James, along with a notebook documenting his work; deeds, estate papers, diplomas, and other family documents.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
